etymologies: late 16th century: modern Latin, from Greek anastomōsis, from anastomoun ‘provide with a mouth’

definitions: a cross-connection between adjacent channels, tubes, fibers, or other parts of a network.
shortDefinitions: cross-connection between adjacent channels, tubes, fibres

definitions: a connection made surgically between adjacent blood vessels, parts of the intestine, or other channels of the body, or the operation in which this is constructed

examples.text: collateral veins are likely to develop across the anastomosis within a few months
a new technique of intestinal anastomosis was devised

shortDefinitions: connection made surgically between adjacent blood vessels, parts of intestine
